Cohen's d Effect Size with Confidence Intervals

Source: R/modeling.R
cohens_d_table.Rd

Calculate Cohen's d effect size for group comparisons with bootstrap confidence intervals. JCP publication standard.

Usage

cohens_d_table(
  data,
  outcome,
  group,
  paired = FALSE,
  pooled_sd = !paired,
  ci_method = c("nct", "bootstrap"),
  conf_level = 0.95,
  boot_n = 1000
)

Arguments

data

Data frame

outcome

Character. Name of outcome variable

group

Character. Name of grouping variable (must have exactly 2 levels)

paired

Logical. Are observations paired? (default FALSE)

pooled_sd

Logical. Use pooled SD? (default TRUE for independent, FALSE for paired)

ci_method

Character. CI method: "nct" (default, non-central t), "bootstrap"

conf_level

Numeric. Confidence level (default 0.95)

boot_n

Integer. Number of bootstrap samples if ci_method = "bootstrap" (default 1000)

Value

A tibble with one row containing:

  • group1, group2: Group labels

  • cohens_d: Cohen's d estimate

  • ci_lower, ci_upper: Confidence interval

  • interpretation: Effect size interpretation

  • n1, n2: Sample sizes

Details

**Cohen's d interpretation:** - |d| = 0.20: Small effect - |d| = 0.50: Medium effect - |d| = 0.80: Large effect

**CI Methods:** - "nct": Non-central t (faster, assumes normality) - "bootstrap": Bootstrap (slower, no distributional assumptions)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
df <- data.frame(
  satisfaction = c(5, 6, 7, 8, 3, 4, 5, 6),
  condition = rep(c("treatment", "control"), each = 4)
)

effect_size <- cohens_d_table(df, "satisfaction", "condition")
print(effect_size)
} # }
